newsitem.title: UK: C&W, Nynex, Bell Canada merge UK units.
newsitem.headline: C&W, Nynex, Bell Canada merge UK units.

text.p: Cable & Wireless, NYNEX and Bell Canada International said on Tuesday they had reached agreement to merge their British subsidiaries and affiliates into one company providing integrated telecommunications, information and entertainment services.

The deal merges Mercury Communications, NYNEX CableComms Group Plc and NYNEX CableComms Group Inc, Bell Cablemedia Plc and Videotron Holdings Plc. The new company will be called Cable & Wireless Communications, the groups said in a statement.
Earlier Bell Cablemedia said it planned to buy the rest of Videotron. It already owns 26 percent of the company.

Cable & Wireless Communications would provide "local, national, international, data and mobile telecommunications, together with multichannel television and Internet services" to around six million franchised homes and to businesses throughout Britain, the groups said.

Richard Brown, chief executive of Cable & Wireless, said the new company would be the only company in Britain able to offer multiple services that until now people had to get from different providers.

The companies said the new company would increase its revenues by providing a wider range of services to existing customers and increased access to a broader customer base. It would also produce "significant cost savings" by eliminating duplication, enhancing purchasing power and increasing capital expenditure efficiencies.
